pull.title: Add a way to limit deserialized string lengths and use it.

rename.from: Add a way to limit deserialized string lengths and use it for subver
rename.to: Add a way to limit deserialized string lengths and use it.

events.body: What about the allowed lengths? Does this need a BIP or a definition anywhere or are they defined already?

events.message:
Add a way to limit deserialized string lengths

and use it for most strings being serialized.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4655_216e9a4456207f5ae9cd85926521851e11a26d92/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

While we're in this space, we might want to also make GetWarnings run SanitizeString on its outputâ€” there are a couple of different paths for text to end up there (including alerts) and we should probably belt and suspenders that nothing weird comes out.  (As a rule we should avoid using strings on the network, and where we do use them always sanitize them both for length and content).
ACK. (Also, I've had this running on the network in valgrind for two days without issue)

issue.title: Why max user agent length in btcd is different from bitcoin?
issue.body: The MaxUserAgentLen of btcd defined in msgversion.go is 2000 where MAX_SUBVERSION_LENGTH of bitcoin  defined in net.h is 256, why are they different? And if btcd node sends a version message which user agent length greater than 256, other bitcoin nodes will reject the message?
